meanings.definition: A person or group made to bear the blame for others or to suffer in their place.
meanings.sent1: The scapegoats were unfairly blamed for the mistake.
meanings.sent2: The scapegoats were innocent but took the blame.
meanings.sent3: The scapegoats decided to throw a blame party and have some fun.
meanings.sent4: Being a scapegoat felt like carrying the weight of the world on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the scapegoats being blamed stuck in everyone's minds.

meanings.sent1: He scapegoats others to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent2: She scapegoats her teammates when things go wrong.
meanings.sent3: The boss tried to scapegoat the coffee machine for the office's problems.
meanings.sent4: Scapegoating only creates a cycle of blame and mistrust.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to scapegoat the opposition backfired.
